Description:
Performs general or cost accounting activities requiring some insight and depth of understanding.
Applies accounting techniques and standard practices to the classification and recording of financial transactions.
Managing ATC’s accounts payable and receivable
Handling the cash expenditures/transactions and initiating relevant daily/monthly reports.
Maintaining company accounting journals while ensuring all updates are implemented for receipt voucher.
Handling payments to all vendors/providers while ensuring full adherence to indicated ‘Terms & Conditions’ in all contracts.
Cross-checking invoices with payments and expenses to ensure accuracy.
Handle Ops. requirements (Services/purchases/vendors).
Conducting detailed checks on Ops. mission reports to ensure mirroring with monthly vehicle invoices.
Ensures that accounting activities are performed according to legislation & governmental laws.
Assist in the consolidation of balance sheets, profit and loss, etc
Develops non-standard reports and statements as required.
Constant improving and/or modifying standard/ procedures.
Drafts segments of statements and reports.
Assist in some assignments involving analysis of data.
Work is generally reviewed at completion for accuracy and soundness.
Assures adequate documentation/support of transactions and reports.
May prepare or significantly contribute to preparation of a variety of reasonably standard, periodic "intermediate" or "end products," such as cost reports, trial balances, balance sheets, profit-and-loss statements or statements of sourcing and application of funds.
As requested, prepares appropriate commentary or explanations relating to report items of particular interest or significance.
May contact staff personnel for the purpose of supplying or explaining data, securing information, or describing additional data which could be made available; may furnish limited advice on accounting matters, especially were based on well-established principles and practices.
Responsible for the cash custody handled to drivers and proceeding with the daily registration. 
updating the company online system ZOHOSkills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree holder with a proven track record of academic or work experience in the Finance sector.
Knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting, and cost control principles.
Proven command of negotiation skills to build long-lasting partnerships with clients.
Adept in data analysis, interpretation, and use of modern accounting techniques.
Reporting Skills
Proficient use of Microsoft Office and its applications.
